definition: Chien-Ming Wang (1980-), Taiwanese starting pitcher for the Washington Nationals in Major League Baseball
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: Nationals' Wang earns win, gets first hit.
sentences.chinese: 国民队王建民拿胜投，还敲出首支安打。

sentences.english: I kidded Wang about showing his face at Fenway Park next week.
sentences.chinese: 我跟王建民开玩笑要他下礼拜到芬威球场露个脸。

sentences.english: On the field his demeanour is steely and calm.
sentences.chinese: 在球场上，王建民是钢铁般的坚强和沉著冷静。

sentences.english: Last Friday, Wang responded with eight shutout innings against the A's .
sentences.chinese: 上星期五，王建民主投八局无失分打败运动家队。

sentences.english: In other words, Wang will become a free agent once again.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说王建民确定将再度成为自由球员。

sentences.english: Home runs boost Wang, Nationals to win.
sentences.chinese: 全垒打助王建民一臂之力，国民胜出。

sentences.english: And that was all Wang needed for another quiet win.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是王建民安静的胜投中所需要的元素。

sentences.english: Wang is the dark horse for Yankees this year.
sentences.chinese: 王建民是今年洋基队的黑马。

sentences.english: But mostly, Guidry conceded, Wang gets outs with the sinker.
sentences.chinese: 但是大部分的时间王建民都是投伸卡球。

sentences.english: Stop thinking Cy Young for Wang already.
sentences.chinese: 不要再认为赛扬奖必然属于王建民的。

definition: Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
Jason Hu (1948-), former Taiwan foreign minister
Yang Yueqing, Chinese-Canadian woman documentary film director
Xu Jun (1962-), Chinese Chinese chess grandmaster
